Clip Class Reference

#include <Clip.hpp>

Collaboration diagram for Clip:

Detailed Description

Press clip where the recognizer has to extract the text from.

This class stores a press clip as a set of pixels from an underlying image that representes the whole page of a newspaper. The class that creates a Clip object should ensure that all the coordinates passed to the constructor are correct, though the constructor makes some simple tests.

Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-08

Member Function Documentation

unsigned char & Clip::operator() ( const unsigned int &  row,
const unsigned int &  column 
) [inline]

Allows access to a pixel in the clip.

Parameters:
row The row where the pixel is at.
column The column where the pixel is at.
Returns:
A reference to the gray level of the pixel at the desired location that allows modifications.
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-20
If either the x coordinate or the y coordinate are out of the image borders, an exception is thrown. The gray level must be normalized in a value from 0 to 255, otherwise it is truncated.
